result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jennifer L Buford was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court IMPOSES  3.5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  

The Court STAYS this sentences and places Ms. Buford on Probation for a term of 3 years.

--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance

miscConds.notes:
--Comply with all conditions of the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--Absolute Sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 160 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120 days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order) Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.


--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:14pm [mo]
Defendant Jennifer L Buford in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Buford guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Ms. Buford disputes arguments by DA Happ

The Court approves the joint recommendation of the parties; gives basis 

On Count #1:
The Court IMPOSES  3.5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  

The Court STAYS this sentences and places Ms. Buford on Probation for a term of 3 years, with conditions: 

--to serve 160 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120 days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order) Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.
--Comply with all conditions of the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--Absolute Sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--To pay fine of $1500+ costs= $2,908.00
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given

recess:2:46pm

Case called at 1:18pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Jennifer L Buford in court, in custody with attorney De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  Defendant Jennifer L Buford in custody.   
PD will appoint counsel.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Atty. Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement of counsel, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights are given.

The Court requires a $5,000.00   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, package houses. - except at T and T Gentelman's Club in Lebanon for work purposes only and not to include serving alcohol. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess 1:27pm

NEXT:  (Notices to be mailed.) 
(1) Pretrial Conference on 2/11/15 at 9:40am.
(2)  Status 3/31/15 at 10:30am
